intro: Fagelia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá fagelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
